meanings.definition: A large bird of prey with a bald head and sharp beak.
meanings.sent1: The vultures soared high in the sky, searching for food.
meanings.sent2: I saw vultures circling above the desert, looking for their next meal.
meanings.sent3: The vultures played a crucial role in the ecosystem by cleaning up carcasses.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like vultures, sharp and focused on any opportunity.
meanings.sent5: The vultures' keen eyesight helped them spot prey from great distances.

meanings.definition: A person or group that preys on others for personal gain.
meanings.sent1: The greedy vultures took advantage of the vulnerable villagers.
meanings.sent2: Beware of the vultures who try to exploit your kindness for their benefit.
meanings.sent3: The vultures in the corporate world always seek to profit at the expense of others.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a vulture, swooping in to take what was not rightfully hers.
meanings.sent5: The vultures of society feed on the misfortunes of those around them.
